page.title: 18Houses
page.content: {We guessed that there are 1107 houses {lived in around Lyndhurst, and if {about three people lived in them there {would be about 3000 people.}Queens house stands where the old Manor house used to be.{The Verderers hall was {built in 1388, here sits the court the {second oldest court in England. Northerwood House 1700, now let as flats.{Forest dwellings use to be made {from mud, cowdung, horse hair etc some {examples still remain.}Thatched cottages exist.{Houses built around {1900 are of brick and slate roof. There are three council house sites. {House prices are high Â£60,000 (three {bedrooms) because of a shortage of {land.}Land is either for farms, or the Forestry commission.{New houses are {built when houses with large gardens {are sold and the site is re developed. The village can not be enlarged.
